page.title: 05CHRISTCHURCH CASTLE I
page.content: {Twynham}castle was built sometime in the twelfth century. It is located in {Christchurch.}In those days the town was called{Twynham.}The castle was in the town centre which was very small it is between Castle Street and the River Avon. It was built for the Lord and his servants to protect themselves in an attack. Henry 1 gave Twynham to his cousin{Baldwin de Redvers}in around 1100. A large artificial mound was made and a strong stone keep built on top of it. This was easy to defend but it was made out of stone, which made it cold and uncomfortable. The lower floor was for the servants. The lords had no time because they were busy elsewhere,So a{Constable}was appointed to command the castle. That is what the other ruin is opposite the castle, the{Constable's house.
